main event: The UFO incident occurred on March 9, 1957, between Mockville and Arrity, North Carolina, involving sightings by multiple pilots and crew members from different flights.
interesting points: The object was described as a metallic, circular craft measuring approximately 50 feet in diameter and had a long, round nose. It was observed to move on an irregular course at altitudes ranging from 2000 to 500 feet, and it appeared to climb slowly before disappearing from view.

The sighting was accompanied by a high-pitched, buzzing or hissing sound and was characterized by extreme brightness, resembling premium grade and white objects. Furthermore, it was observed descending at controlled speeds in almost vertical-like descents.
Another pilot located 175 miles away observed the same objects at the same time, ruling out the possibility of normal aircraft or guided missiles in the area.

The object was not visible at the time and place reported, indicating that it was not connected to any conventional aircraft or missile operations. Additionally, attempts to relate the sighting to phenomena like Venus were ruled out.
The report discusses a similar sighting on May 8, 1952, involving a near-collision and on April 27, 1954, when several PAA pilots saw and photographed similar objects over the same area.
sighted object: Metallic, circular craft measuring approximately 50 feet in diameter
witnesses: Multiple pilots and crew members from different flights
photographs: No photographs were present in the report
